utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s amazing people keep coming to comic book stores instead of just downloading comics digitally.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s probably for the best. For a lot of these guys, the weekly trip here is the only chance their mom has to go down to the basement and change their sheets.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, that reminds me, I get fresh sheets tonight. Yay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well? What do you think of New Comic Book Night? Magic, huh?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m disappointed. As a brilliant man, you’re entitled to a vice. I could understand frequenting an opium den or hunting your fellow man for sport. But this? Lame-o.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, A, comic books employ storytelling through sequential art, a medium that dates back 17,000 years to the cave paintings of Lascaux, and B, you play the harp. Like that’s cool.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Can I help you find anything?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: A comic that depicts a woman whose bosom can’t be used as a floatation device.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Sorry. Most of the guys who come in here like big boobs. Couple of them have big boobs.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, look, the new Warlords of Ka’a expansion pack is out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A new one? Unbelievable. They just keep making up more cheesy monsters, slapping them on cards and selling them at 25 bucks a pop. It’s like a secret tax on guys who can’t get laid.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: They’re not even trying. Remember the Satanimals pack with the Hellephant? Why, absurd. What was he, a bad elephant who died and went to hell? What could an elephant possibly do that would cause him eternal damnation?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wild West and Witches? What kind of loser cares about a showdown between Billy the Kid and the White Wizard of the North?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A total loser. Obviously a guy with a six-shooter beats an old man with a magic wand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, ho-hold on. What if the wizard casts a Helmet of Confusion spell on Billy the Kid’s cowboy hat?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What? Please! This is Billy the Kid we’re talking about. I mean, the wizard would get shot between the eyes before he could ever get out the words, what the hell is Billy the Kid doing in the mystic realm of Ka’a?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Leonard, what’s the deal with Sheldon’s friend Amy? Are they a couple?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Couple of weirdos. Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You interested in Amy?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, I mean, she didn’t look through me with soul-sucking, ball-shriveling hatred and contempt. I like that in a woman. Could you run it by Sheldon if I could ask her out?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure. I guess.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Stuart, settle an argument for us. Who would win, Billy the Kid or the White Wizard?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: If I tell you that, I’m robbing you of the hours of fun you could have for the magical, rootin’ tootin’ low price of $24.95.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ll take one.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mmm, make it two.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I hate all of you and myself. Three.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I’ll ring it up. Like shooting nerds in a barrel.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, can I talk to you about something? It’s a little awkward.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know what this is about. Given the professional standstill you’re at, you’re wondering if this is the appropriate time to abandon your research and focus on teaching. Yes. And if I may suggest, consider changing disciplines. Yeah, to the humanities, perhaps history. One of the advantages of teaching history is that you don’t have to create things, you know, you just have to remember stuff that happened and then parrot it back. You could have fun with that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s not it. Stuart’s kind of interested in Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, of course he is. She’s very interesting. Did you know, when she was 14, she severed the webbing between her own toes?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. He wanted me to find out if you’d have a problem with him asking her out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not sure how to respond, Leonard. I don’t own Amy. Can’t own a person. At least not since? 1863. President Lincoln freed the? Slaves! Come on Leonard, if you’re going to teach history, these are the kind of facts you’ll have to know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what? Never mind. I’m going to tell him it’s okay to ask her out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The question is moot. There is no way that Stuart, an impoverished peddler of picture books, would be at all appealing to Amy Farrah Fowler, a noted neurobiologist capable of performing surgery on her own feet with nothing but nitrous oxide from cans of whipped cream as anesthesia.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, but just for the record, I checked in with you to see how you’d feel about it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. The record shall so reflect. Now, getting back to the problem at hand, what to do with a washed-up experimental physicist.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I am not washed-up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard. Lots of people love you and want to help you, but they can’t until you admit the problem.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, ladies, we killed the bottle.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I had half a glass.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I didn’t have any.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, don’t judge me. So, what do you want to do, go to the movies, go dancing, lay down for a little bit?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Or we play Travel Twister.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Amy, really? Twister?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Excuse me. I’ve passed many an enjoyable evening playing this game. And I’m sure it’s a lot more exciting when you play with other people. What do you say, bestie? We can do shirts and skins. I’m shirts. Called it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m too small for Twister. And roller coasters. And sitting with my feet on the floor. Hope you enjoyed the prenatal cigarettes, Mom.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, you know, my mom smoked pot when she was pregnant with me, and I turned out just fine. Hey, look, I have peach schnapps. Thank God.

utterance.speaker: Amy (reading a text on her phone)
utterance.content: Guys, something happened.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think a boy likes me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (reading)
utterance.content: Hi. It’s Stuart. We met at the comic book store. I was wondering if you’d like to get coffee sometime. It’s okay if you say no. It might be the kick in the pants I need to start taking Zoloft.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy, little vixen. Just working it under all those layers of wool and polyester.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What are you going to do? Doesn’t he know you have a boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, she doesn’t have a boyfriend, she has a Sheldon. So do you like Stuart?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know. He’s nice. He’s funny. He has the sallow, drawn countenance associated with an overactive thyroid gland. That’s kind of hot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, sweetie, we all love Sheldon, but you’ve been with him over a year now. If it’s not going anywhere, what does it hurt to look around?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, yeah, I guess they’re not engaged like me and Howie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, for what it’s worth, engaged people can look around, too. Lot of options out there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where’s Stuart?

utterance.speaker: Speccy Guy Behind Counter (sniggering)
utterance.content: Out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: Speccy Guy
utterance.content: I’m Dale. He left me in charge.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Dale
utterance.content: Yeah. I don’t get it, either.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I want to return this Wild West and Witches Ka’a expansion pack.

utterance.speaker: Dale
utterance.content: Sorry. I don’t do returns. They’re hard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure, sure. Uh, when will Stuart be back?

utterance.speaker: Dale
utterance.content: I don’t know. He went out for coffee. With a girl.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I guess I was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Am I okay? Leonard, I’m on a lifelong trajectory that includes a Nobel Prize and cities named after me, all four wisdom teeth fit comfortably in my mouth without need of extraction, and my bowel movements run like a German train schedule. Am I okay?

utterance.speaker: Dale
utterance.content: I’m okay, too!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wild Bill Witchcock.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A tribe of Abra-Comanches.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Flaming Spittoon. And for the record, I’m very disappointed in you cowpokes. We’re playing our inaugural round of Wild West and Witches, and I’m the only one who bothered to dress for the occasion. Patooie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re not wearing cowboy hats, Sheldon. It looks ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I suppose my boots and spurs are ridiculous, too?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Very.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Incredibly so.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did it look ridiculous when we got the Satanimals pack and I dressed up as a Beelzebobcat?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Very.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Incredibly so.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, fine. Let’s just play.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We should go easy on him. Amy’s out with Stuart tonight.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Are you telling me that Sheldon’s patented blend of condescension and no sex isn’t enough to hold on to a woman?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cluck, cluck, cluck. What are we, ladies at a quilting bee? Or are we men playing a fantasy card game set in a magical frontier town?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry. Creepy Tepee.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Annie Ogly.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hocus Pocus Pocahontas.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And may I point out it is the three of you who are obsessed with Stuart and Amy, not me. I think you need to ask yourselves who’s really being ridiculous here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You are.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Totally you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, guys, check it out. The deluxe limited edition Wild West and Witches expansion pack in the signed and numbered collector’s tin.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh come on, no! We just bought the regular pack.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ooh, a sheriff’s badge.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s also a wand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: With a hologram? Nice. Hey, do you see this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m in the matrix, Leonard, I see everything.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’ve got to be kidding me. You friended Stuart on Facebook?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I thought you didn’t like Facebook anymore.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t be silly. I’m a fan of anything that tries to replace actual human contact.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Please. You’re looking at Facebook to find out how their date went.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? You think I care if a man, what, shared a pumpkin latte with a dynamite lady?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re so full of it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You are free to believe whatever you like. And unfriend Rajesh Koothrappali.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You unfriended me? Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Now he’s gonna miss all those great updates like, I can’t believe I waited this long to make my own potpourri.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, why don’t you just acknowledge that you have feelings for Amy and you don’t want her going out with other men?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And unfriend Leonard Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Here’s a radical thought. Go old-school, challenge Stuart to a fight. I mean, nothing makes the ladies hotter than two skinny white guys swatting at each other with their eyes closed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And unfriend Howard Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s all of us. Can I use the laptop?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I have to buy that stupid collector’s tin.

utterance.speaker: Penny (off)
utterance.content: Who do we love?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny (off)
utterance.content: Who do we love?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny (off)
utterance.content: Who do we love?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hello, Sheldon. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I came to ask if you would like to go on a date with me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A date. You and me. Dining, dancing, perhaps you’d like to take in a prizefight.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: God, are you trying to make Amy jealous?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Why is everyone so obsessed with Amy and Stuart? And whether or not they may be having more pumpkin lattes or intercourse tonight.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, listen to me. Playing games is not gonna help get Amy back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am not trying to get her back. But, out of curiosity, what is a way?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, honey, let me tell you a story. There was a guy I liked, and I never told him how I felt. Eventually, he started going out with someone else, and I always regretted it. Do you see where I’m going with this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I believe I do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m the guy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re not the guy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure? That would explain so much. Your constant presence in my apartment, that baffling dalliance with Leonard just to be near me, the way you call me sweetie all the time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I call everyone sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You tramp.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, Sheldon, all I’m saying is strap on a pair and go talk to Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Strap on a pair? Of what, skates?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie, you are so not the guy.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: If you’re bored, you can go. I understand.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I’m having a nice time.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Don’t patronize me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. Excuse me. Pardon me. Pardon me. Excuse me. Hi, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Pardon me. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The thought of you sitting in a darkened theatre with a character like Stuart is repellent. No offence, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: None taken. Although repellent is kind of a, kind of a strong word.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry this causes you discomfort, but based on the currently established parameters of our relationship, I can put myself in any repellent situation I want.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Um, again…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Stuart, please. You’re being rude.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Anything else?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I believe I would like to alter the paradigm of our relationship.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m listening.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: With the understanding that nothing changes whatsoever, physical or otherwise, I would not object to us no longer characterizing you as not my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Interesting. Now try it without the quadruple negative.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re being impossible.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Amy, will you be my girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s enough of that. Sorry to interrupt. You two enjoy your date. Here’s a dollar for your troubles. Get yourself some Sour Patch Kids.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So, other than you taking your relationship to the next level with another guy, this was nice.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, well, thanks for seeing me to my door.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, you’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (inside)
utterance.content: Amy. Amy. Amy. Let’s wrap things up out there.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Um, good night, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (inside)
utterance.content: Take the hint, Stuart. The lady said good night.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How did you get into my apartment?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wow. Is that the kind of nagging I can expect now that you’re my girlfriend? Good thing I drew this up.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I present to you the relationship agreement. A binding covenant that, in its 31 pages, enumerates, iterates and codifies the rights and responsibilities of Sheldon Lee Cooper, here and after known as the boyfriend, and Amy Farrah Fowler, here and after known as the girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s so romantic.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mutual indemnification always is. Why don’t you start perusing while I set up my notary stamp.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Section 5: Hand-holding. Hand-holding is only allowed under the following circumstances. A: Either party is in danger of falling off a cliff, precipice or ledge. B: Either party is deserving of a hearty handshake after winning a Nobel Prize. C: Moral support during flu shots. Seems a bit restrictive.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Feel free to retain a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Penny, I said right hand red.

utterance.speaker: Penny (picking up wine)
utterance.content: Yeah, I heard you. I got red.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Bernadette, left foot yellow.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We should play limbo next. No one beats me at limbo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny. Amy. Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s my boyfriend. It’s open!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I got a splinter.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What do you want me to do about it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Relationship agreement Section 4, Boo-boos and Ouchies. You have to take care of it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I should’ve gotten a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Looks like it’s just us playing. Penny? Penny, we’re out of wine!

utterance.speaker: Penny (waking, bleary)
utterance.content: You should probably drive.
